ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In general, would you say your health is:
Notes: 1= Excellent; 2= Very Good; 3= Good; 4= Fair; 5= Poor ; 888=Don't Know/not sure; -999=Missing

ElementDescription: How would you rate your quality of life?
Notes: 1=Very poor 2=Poor; 3=Neither poor nor good; 4=Good; 5=Very good; 998=Don't know; 999=No answer

ElementDescription: In general, how would you rate your physical health?
Notes: 1= Excellent; 2= Very Good; 3= Good; 4= Fair; 5= Poor

ElementDescription: In general, how would you rate your mental health, including your mood and your ability to think?
Notes: 1= Excellent; 2= Very Good; 3= Good; 4= Fair; 5= Poor

ElementDescription: In general, how would you rate your satisfaction with your social activities and relationships?
Notes: 1= Excellent; 2= Very Good; 3= Good; 4= Fair; 5= Poor

ElementDescription: In general, please rate how well you carry out your usual social activities and roles. (This includes activities at home, at work and in your community, and responsibilities as a parent, child spouse, employee, friend, etc.)
Notes: 1= Excellent; 2= Very Good; 3= Good; 4= Fair; 5= Poor

Race
Notes: 1 = American Indian or Alaska Native; 2 = Asian; 3 = Black or African American; 4 = Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; 5 = White or Caucasian; 6 = More Than One Race; 88 = Unknown; 99 = Choose not to report

ElementDescription: Caregiver or Child - Total two-item Global Physical Health (GPH-2) score
Notes: Sum of reverse-scored items promis_global01 (in general, would you say your health is...) and promis_global06 (rate how well you carry out your usual social activities and roles). Higher GPH-2 scores reflect greater physical health complaints. Both domains of physical health functioning reflect greater values associated with worse health; 999 = No data (participant did not see/complete that scale)

ElementDescription: In general, how would you rate your health?
Notes: 1= Excellent; 2= Very Good; 3= Good; 4= Fair; 5= Poor

ElementDescription: To what extent are you/your child able to carry out your everyday physical activities such as walking, climbing stairs, carrying your school bag/backpack, or moving a chair?
Notes: 5=Completely; 4=Mostly; 3=Moderately; 2=A little; 1=Not at all; 777 = Participant should have replied but did not (accidental or intentional skip); 999 = No data (participant did not see/complete that scale)

ElementDescription: Total two-item PROMIS Scale v1.2 - Global Physical Health (GPH-2a) score
Notes: Sum of pgh_03a (in general, would you rate your health?) and the reverse code of promis_global06a (To what extent are you able to carry out...). Higher GPH-2a scores reflect greater physical health complaints. Both domains of physical health functioning reflect greater values associated with worse health; 999 = No data (participant did not see/complete that scale)

In the past 7 days, my child had trouble sleeping when he/she had pain.

ElementDescription: Have you ever had persistent pain? That is pain that lasted longer than one month? This pain may have come and gone, but stayed with you for over a month.
If YES, about how many total months or years did you have this pain?
Notes: 1=0-5 months; 2=6-11 months; 3=1-4 years; 4=5-9 years; 5=10-14 years; 6=15-20 years; 7=More than 20 years; 88=Not applicable

ElementDescription: If YES, how many months or years has it been since you last had this pain?
Notes: 1=0-5 months; 2=6-11 months; 3=1-4 years; 4=5-9 years; 5=10-14 years; 6=15-20 years; 7=More than 20 years; 88=Not applicable

ElementDescription: How much did pain interfere with your usual activities?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= A little; 3= Moderately; 4= Mostly; 5= Completely
